thread.title: Slain Whittier officer honored with procession
thread.title_full: Slain Whittier officer honored with procession

title: Slain Whittier officer honored with procession
text:
EMBED </> More News Videos <iframe width="476" height="267" src="http://abc7.com/video/embed/?pid=1764073" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe> 
The Whittier police officer who was killed in the line of duty was honored by fellow law enforcement officials in a procession on Monday. KABC Monday, February 20, 2017 02:56PM SANTA ANA, Calif. (KABC) -- The Whittier police officer who was killed in the line of duty during a shootout on Monday was honored by fellow law enforcement officials in a procession. WATCH LIVE: ABC7 continuing coverage of deadly officer-involved shootout in Whittier The officer's body was escorted via motorcade from UC Irvine Medical Center in Orange to the Orange County Coroner's Office in Santa Ana.A long line of law enforcement officials saluted the officer's flag-draped body as it was wheeled into the coroner's office.The officer's identity was not immediately released.The officer was killed and another was wounded in a shooting while they were responding to a report of a traffic accident near Mar Vista Street and Colima Road shortly before 8:30 a.m. Monday.According to investigators, the officers approached the man reportedly responsible for the accident and were in the process of patting him down for weapons. That's when the suspect opened fire, hitting both officers.At least one of the officers returned fire, hitting the suspect. The wounded second officer and the suspect are expected to survive.The Whittier Police Department has about 125 sworn officers who police Whittier and Santa Fe Springs in southeastern Los Angeles County.
